technical_features.source_sentence: CELS-patterned QLEDs show remarkable external quantum efficiencies (19.1%, 17.5%, 12.0% for red, green, blue, respectively) and a long operation lifetime.
a long operation lifetime (T95 at 1000 nits up to 8700 h).
Chloride anions passivate surface defects and endow patterned quantum dots with preserved photoluminescent quantum yields.
Cl⁻ anions passivate surface defects and endow patterned quantum dots with preserved photoluminescent quantum yields.
It works for both cadmium-based and heavy-metal-free quantum dots.

qualitative_insights.main_objective: Develop a light-triggered, carbocation-enabled ligand stripping (CELS) method to pattern quantum dot light-emitting diodes (QLEDs) with high efficiency and stability, bridging the performance gap between patterned and non-patterned devices.
key_materials_studied: Triphenylmethyl chloride (TPCl) as a photosensitive additive
qualitative_insights.key_methodology_summary: CELS uses UV light to photogenerate carbocations (TP⁺) and chloride anions (Cl⁻) from TPCl. TP⁺ strips native ligands from QDs to enable high-resolution patterning, while Cl⁻ passivates surface defects. The process involves film coating, UV exposure via photomasks, and developer solvent removal of unexposed QDs.
primary_findings_conclusions: CELS-patterned QLEDs achieved record external quantum efficiencies (19.1% red, 17.5% green, 12.0% blue) and operational lifetimes (T₉₅ at 1000 nits up to 8700 hours).
Surface chlorination by Cl⁻ preserved photoluminescent quantum yields (PLQYs) and improved photostability.
The method works for both cadmium-based and heavy-metal-free QDs with resolutions down to ~4 μm.
limitations_discussed_by_authors: Blue QLEDs showed lower PLQY retention (62%) compared to red (100%) and green (85%).
Resolution limited to ~4 μm, potentially insufficient for ultra-high-definition displays.
future_work_suggested_by_authors: Exploring alternative photosensitive chemicals with similar reaction mechanisms to improve patterning capabilities.
Integration with optimized QD materials and device architectures for commercial displays.
qualitative_insights.novelty_significance_claim: CELS represents a material-tailored photopatterning approach that achieves patterned QLEDs with performance comparable to state-of-the-art nonpatterned devices, addressing a critical bottleneck in display commercialization.
qualitative_insights.key_tables_figures_present: Figure 5 (EL characteristics), Figure 4 (PL properties and DFT analysis), Tables S1-S4 (performance comparisons).
